pronunciation: PREMED'ITATE, [Latin proemeditor; proe, before, and meditor, to mediate.]

definitions.text:
Premeditate
 [Latin proemeditor; proe, before, and meditor, to mediate.] To think on and revolve in the mind beforehand; to contrive and design previously; as, to premeditate theft or robbery.With words premeditated thus he said.PREMED'ITATE,
To think, consider or revolve in the mind beforehand; to deliberate; to have formed in the mind by previous thought or meditation.PREMED'ITATE,
